<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Striker's Scroll](/Feats.aspx?ID=2858) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=389" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 45 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Spellstrike](/Actions.aspx?ID=755)

</column>

---

You can attach a scroll to your weapon or [_handwraps of mighty blows_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=441) to blend its spell into an attack, carefully folding it around a part of the weapon or sealing it to the weapon's surface. Attaching a scroll requires using the [Affix a Talisman](/Actions.aspx?ID=520) action. You can have only one scroll affixed to a weapon at a time, and you can't have both a talisman and scroll attached.

 You can Cast the Spell from the scroll as part of a Spellstrike, assuming the spell is one you could normally use with Spellstrike. You can't Cast the Spell in any other way while it's affixed, though you can use Affix a Talisman again to remove the scroll and use it as a normal—if a bit crumpled—scroll.
name: Striker's Scroll
